subject: Real Estate
title: Greek City-States and Land Citizenship
description: A quick, practical guide to Greek City-States and Land Citizenship.

hook.text: In Athens, only citizens could own land. Foreigners, no matter how rich, were locked out.

buildup.text: Land ownership was tied to political rights â€” if you couldn't own soil, you couldn't vote.

discovery.text: Wealthy non-citizens called metics ran businesses but had to rent. They built Athens yet owned none of it.

twist.text: Sparta took the opposite path. The state assigned equal plots to every citizen at birth.

climax.text: Both systems collapsed. Athens grew too exclusive; Sparta's equality crumbled as land concentrated.

punchline.text: Who can own land decides who holds power.

quiz.question: Who could own land in ancient Athens?
